body: In theory, that's a bug. But we need more information on how to reproduce the issue. He is supposed to have signed in in at least one. He may get an unauthenticated token in the other, yes.

Here's an example: 
I use Gmail in one tab and Drive in another tab. When I log out from say Gmail and then later if I try to log out from Google Drive, I am redirected to login page again.

Whereas with Devise  if I do the same thing, I get  "ActionController::InvalidAuthenticityToken in Devise::SessionsController#destroy" error instead of being redirected to log in page. This kinda errors gives an impression of application crash to the users. It would be great if Devise could handle this internally like other major apps.  

I have come up with a work around that would temporarily resolve this issue. See StackOverflow Question
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22487290/invalidauthenticitytoken-in-devisesessionscontrollerdestroy-sign-out-after-a
That sounds good. Can you please submit a pull request? :)

I get the same error (ActionController::InvalidAuthenticityToken in Devise::SessionsController#destroy - Can't verify CSRF token authenticity) when I perform the following sequence with a fresh install of Devise:
1. log in with 'Remember Me' checked
2. close the browser 
3. re-open browser and return to site (and verify I'm still logged in)
4. attempt to log out (<%= link_to('Logout', destroy_user_session_path, :method => :delete) %>)

Can anyone replicate this? I wasn't sure if it was the same issue or a separate one.

issue.title: Check if there is a logged user before logout.

repository.name: devise
repository.description: Flexible authentication solution for Rails with Warden.

issue.body:
Only execute the `SessionsController#destroy` if there is a logged in
user, otherwise it will raise `ActionController::InvalidAuthenticityToken`.

Fixes #2934.

cc @josevalim @lucasmazza

issue.title: Devise 3.4.1: InvalidAuthenticityToken when destroying sessions, able to reproduce

repository.name: devise
repository.description: Flexible authentication solution for Rails with Warden.

issue.body:
`Rails 4.2.0 (turbolinks enabled)` with `Devise 3.4.1` using `Ruby 2.2`:

There are multiple closed tickets which say this bug is fixed but it's still occurring.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Sign in with `remember me` checked
2. Close browser
3. Open browser
4. You should be signed in still, but signing out causes the `InvalidAuthenticityToken` error

This only occurs if you do steps 2 and 3. You can sign out with remember me checked as long as you don't close your browser.

Related issue: https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/2934#issuecomment-38470704

Current fix: https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/3265#issuecomment-66228217 thanks to @tabishiqbal
